data.title: Game-Timer is important
data.body:
after the new UI for Red-Alert was released , it took some time (as regular player) until ive made my peace with it ... but ... 
there is one element , that still bothers me alot , and that is the game-timer .. sadly squished into the new 250x500 user-interface as 30x10 pixel graphic output ... which is almost a "6x-sized-down" version from our old timer ... here for comparison ( old one is left , and new one right ) :

![timer](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9139965/5780224/205c39ea-9da9-11e4-89d4-865e03cde5e9.png)

its not as easy to catch the timer in the new UI anymore ... but it should be easy ,  the game-timer is a important element in "RTS-Multiplayer"-games because ... time-management is essential for these type of games ... and should be easily and quick  "accessible" for a players eye 
i show you guys 2 more screenshots , the first one with the old UI ... and the 2nd with the new UI ... please check out the timer in both screenshots ... and think about , which one would suit better for a regular rts - player ...  

![timer1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9139965/5780386/8e785dea-9daa-11e4-8653-8f0e40199c43.png)

![timer2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9139965/5780391/976b8576-9daa-11e4-9f97-1358d6141be4.png)

bzw.: ... in the replay-user-interface ... there is a ticker that constantly switches with the time ... showing a text that says what speed you are playing the replay ... and also when you pause the game ... unfortunately ... this ticker get faster with your chosen replay-speed ... which (on max) switches "timer" and "text" in every second ...  this is another concern 

**so , my suggestion / idea is ... to have (only) the timer back to its old behavior ... separated and centered with a proper size**

data.title: Moved Lint, UtilityCommands and Scripting properties to Mods.Common
data.body:
And BaseAttackNotifier.

The finishing line is clearly in sight now.

data.title: Remove healing ability from d2k barracks
data.body: since it doesn't match the original game.

data.title: Combine PDOX and PDOX.Germany
data.body: Fixes #7330

data.title: Cache or inline some delegates to avoid allocations.
data.body: Standard stuff, just avoiding allocating some delegates that get used a lot to help keep GC activity low.

data.title: Fix wrong template definition in the d2k tileset
data.body:
Fixes this:

![screenshot from 2015-01-14 19 05 12](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4331210/5744377/aca6b7ac-9c20-11e4-81a7-96cbc6124357.png)

data.title: D2k - create separate Sardaukar actor for house Corrino
data.body:
I have not had a chance to check this, but it has been mentioned here on GitHub before, and I saw it in several Dune 2000 wiki sites - the Emperor sardaukar are supposed to be better than the Harkonnen ones. This will require we make such an actor for house Corrino with better stats.
How much better and in what way remains to be determined.
I am leaving this here for easier tracking of remaining tasks.
Anyone can feel free to do it if they feel like it.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/7754690-d2k-create-separate-sardaukar-actor-for-house-corrino?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: TerrainModifiesDamage trait.
data.body:
^Infantry in D2k now take 80% damage if they are standing on Rough terrain.

Closes #7328 
Even if this doesn't belong/exist in D2k it will be nice to have.

I chose to allow negative percentages because if someone wants an actor healed when damaged on a specific tile they should have the ability to do so.

/cc @MicroJOo and @penev92

Note: I won't integrate this with #7110 as they have different purposes.

data.title: Ability to have normal and advanced chronosphere
data.body:
Steps to reproduce:
- Be allies, france or england. Enemy is germany
- Build a chronosphere
- Capture the german construction yard
- Build an advanced chronosphere (normal chronosphere has vanished from the build menu)

data.title: Polished monster-tank-madness
data.body:
What I did:
- The mission shows the "test" of the super tanks at the beginning
- The walls of the outpost belong to the player now
- Improved the super tanks (heal if below 100% and don't eject drivers as you're machines)
- Fixed the tooltips of husks and crates

data.title: D2k rough terrain bonuses
data.body: Someone recently suggested (I'm thinking @Phrohdoh) that the `rough` terrain should provide armor bonus to infantry. I don't have such detailed knowledge so I want to ask here if this is true for Dune 2000. (If someone can check the game files/some game editor, that would be best).

data.title: Teams Together
data.body: Lobby Rework TODO - "teams together" option for team games -- will eliminate most need for manual spawnpoint choosing.

data.title: Useful info for rewriting BlowfishKeyProvider
data.body:
There is a comment in BlowfishKeyProvider.cs stating that it could use a rewrite. If anyone wants to do that, the information at http://www.ppmsite.com/forum/viewtopic.php?t=38717 will probably be useful as it explains what the code in BlowfishKeyProvider actually does and how to reimplement it using standard crypto libraries.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/7671945-useful-info-for-rewriting-blowfishkeyprovider?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Refactored LimitedAmmo to AmmoPool
data.body:
...and moved `Reloads` functionality and `RearmSound` to `AmmoPool`.

Spiritual successor to #6514, but changed approach quite a bit in order to avoid most of the issues #6514 had and slightly improve functionality on top of that.

data.title: Fix power decreasing while the dev hack is enabled
data.body: This should fix #7317.

data.title: Server Fixup
data.body:
Expansion of https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/7099

Now sorted into regions, updated to current OpenRA standards and the dispatch spaghetti is now a tasty meatball. This PR opens the way to a compressed unified data protocol that will significantly reduce bandwidth requirements and code complexity.

data.title: Polished soviet-01
data.body:
What I did:
- Made buildings unsellable
- Let the mission fail, if all airfields are destroyed
- Removed NPC fake objective

Before, the game crashed after selling the topmost airfield.

data.title: Please reduce / close issues which are open but indirectly (superseeded) fixed! :(
data.body:
I looked over a few "crash" issues and noticed that many issues are open but already fixed :(
Example  #6033 #4720

Mailaender said this is an duplicate of #6941 so we should close issues which are already fixed but relaying on other Issues :(

i also put an comment on the fix (after it was merged) for #6941 where i agree thaht the Fix works :/

data.title: Removed Facing: 0 and Health: 1
data.body:
Split from #7261 as requested (https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/7261#issuecomment-69472628).

This PR removes "Facing: 0" on actors that don't use facings and "Health: 1" as it's default in all map.yaml files.

data.title: Removed PerCellDamageWarhead
data.body:
The only reason why I haven't submitted this ages ago is that I have no idea how to tackle this with regard to an upgrade rule.

If this is supposed to have an upgrade rule, either I'll need help or someone else has to take over, unless a simple `PerCellDamage` -> `SpreadDamage` renaming to avoid crashes while ignoring `Size`/`Falloff` is considered sufficient.

data.title: Selling a power plant with Unlimited Power toggled on decreases power
Moved Upgrades, SupportPowers and some misc features to Mods.Common
data.body: And moved some loose traits from the Mods.RA root folder into the Traits folder.

data.title: Prevent EndOfStreamException being thrown in ServerOrder.Deserialize()
data.body:
As there is no PeekChar function for BinaryReader the proposed solution is to compare BaseStream.Position with BaseStream.Length.

Reference:
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/10942848/c-sharp-checking-for-binary-reader-end-of-file

Also added using statements in InterpretServerOrders() and ServerOrder.Serialize().

data.title: Added a levelup command
data.body: Take two. Useful for debugging veterancy problems.

data.title: Fixed airdrop production crash
Missing InWorld check for starport drop
data.body: http://pastebin.com/fNJENkp3

data.title: Switched to the new the Docker-based Travis CI infrastructure
data.body: This has been suggested in https://github.com/travis-ci/travis-ci/issues/3077#issuecomment-69458787 to get timeouts under control.

Especially as you can't control them and your harvester is instantly worm food.
